titleStmt.title: [Claim] 1815, Taw,le,eskee against the United States : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Claim] 1815, Taw,le,eskee against the United States
bibl.note: This document is a claim made in 1815 against the United States by Taw,le,eskee, a Cherokee Indian to recover the value of his mare and a colt believed to be taken by the militia.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

table.head:
Taw le eskee on the Blount road
Claims against the United States

row.cell:
bay mare and
the colts also Bay
both blaze face_

div.p:
To which he states that his creature used above and about Joseph Coodys place as the mare was raised at that place, and the mare & colt was seen by Jenney Coody at the Lick Log - which was in the Spring of the year 1815 and at which time number of the millitia were passing on their return from the mobile, and that he had Diligently hunted for his creatures and enquired of the people living in the neighbourhood neighborhood
and but has never been able to git to get any tidings of them sence since
the they were seen by Said Jene Coody- and that he has Strong reason to believe she and her colt were taken by the millitia militia , because had the mare died the colt would have been found with Mr coodys horses
